answers.author: Michael Webb
answers.text:
We do require highway billboards to obtain a sign permit to construct or upgrade.  They are limited by zoning and also must meet DOT requirements of our State (Kansas).  The sign permit fee is $500.  The installer also may be required to obtain a contractors/business license.

answers.author: Andrea Curtis
answers.text:
Salt Lake City similarly regulates billboards via zoning ordinances. It is an interesting and evolving issue, as one of the major billboard companies is well represented in the state legislature and has successfully presented bills which override cities' abilities to limit billboards. Doug Dansie in the Planning Division has been the primary contact on this issue, if you'd like more specific information.  801-535-6182
